page.title: 07NEW PRIMARY SCHOOL ELMSWELL
page.content: A new school is being built to replace the old one which will be sold. The new school should open in 1986. It will be a one storey brick building which will be heated by oil. Most floors are plastic or carpet, but the hall floor is wood. There will be 5 classrooms, 2 practical rooms (art, craft, woodwork, cookery), a library, T.V. room, large hall, showers, kitchen and servery, kiln room, P.E. store, staffroom, head teacher's room, caretaker's room, and an office. The computer will be moved around on a trolley. The playground is tarmac, 37x27m. with a swimming pool. The children will use the council football pitch next door. We saw the plans when we visited the site. A workman said it might take 750,000 bricks to finish. We saw a pond with ducklings on it.
